ground_truth: People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room, peering in nervously as Dr. Mathison sits beside a black woman who's lying down, gazing into a blanket wrapped bundle. The women smiles at the wriggling bundle as the doctor gently lifts it and looks inside. Still reflected in the mirror, the doctor looks up at the saleswoman and then back at the baby, frowning. A man is leaning against a train window, staring out as the train pulls away from a station. He straightens up, leans back in his seat, wearing a dark gray suit, with the top button of his pale green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted. The little hair he has is close shaved, leaving just a dark shadow. Glancing between the seats in front of him, he sees a little girl lying almost upside down, staring back at him. He grins at her, but the grin fades, and he leans towards the window again, rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A slim woman in her late 20s, wearing a blue top, stretches up to place her coat on the overhead rack, and as she does, the top parts company with her black trousers, and the man gazes at her exposed white midriff and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between top and trousers. He flirtively slips off his wedding ring and drops it into his jacket pocket. The young woman sits down, glances at some leaflets, drops them in the seat pocket, straightens her shoulder-length brown hair, tucks down her top, sits back, and closes her eyes. The man looks down at the seat pocket in front of him, stretches forward, and picks up a magazine, then picks up a second magazine, looks at it himself before passing it to her. The man looks down, swallows, and looks at her again, watching another train pass and looking down before turning to her again. They shake hands, but she looks down at the magazine again, then up at him with her smile gone. She folds and unfolds her arms, tucks her fist under her chin, and shows him her wedding ring. She stands, picks up the leaflets, and moves down the aisle of the train, and his head drops. He pulls his wedding ring from his pocket, hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on, and settles back in his seat. Glancing between the seat backs, David sees a little girl in front sitting up now, her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips, watching him and smiling. He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly, his eyes closing, while outside, trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Individuals are mirrored in the looking glass of a store dressing area, gazing in anxiously as Dr. Mathison perches beside a black female who's reclining, staring into a cover-wrapped parcel. The woman beams at the squirming parcel as the physician softly elevates it and peers inside. Still mirrored in the looking glass, the physician glances up at the salesclerk and then back at the infant, scowling. A gentleman is reclining against a train pane, gazing out as the train departs from a terminal. He straightens, reclines back in his seat, adorned in a dark gray attire, with the top fastener of his light green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted. The scant hair he possesses is closely shorn, leaving just a dark shadow. Peering between the seats in front of him, he observes a little girl reclining almost upside down, gazing back at him. He smirks at her, but the smirk diminishes, and he leans towards the pane again, massaging the inner corner of one eye tiredly. A slender woman in her late 20s, dressed in a blue top, reaches up to place her coat on the overhead shelf, and as she does, the top separates from her black trousers, and the man stares at her exposed white abdomen and the section of ivy tattoo ascending through the gap between top and trousers. He surreptitiously removes his wedding ring and drops it into his coat pocket. The youthful woman sits down, glances at some brochures, drops them in the seat pocket, straightens her shoulder-length brown hair, tucks down her top, reclines, and closes her eyes. The man gazes down at the seat pocket in front of him, stretches forward, and picks up a periodical, then picks up a second periodical, glances at it himself before handing it to her. The man gazes down, gulps, and looks at her again, observing another train pass and looking down before turning to her again. They shake hands, but she gazes down at the periodical again, then up at him with her grin vanished. She folds and unfolds her arms, tucks her fist under her chin, and displays to him her wedding ring. She stands, picks up the brochures, and moves down the aisle of the train, and his head drops. He retrieves his wedding ring from his pocket, hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on, and settles back in his seat. Peering between the seat backs, David observes a little girl in front sitting up now, her blonde hair pulled off her face and secured by yellow clips, watching him and smiling. He shifts out of her sight towards the pane and leans against it scowling slightly, his eyes closing, while outside, trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The mirror of a shop changing room reflects people, who nervously peer in as a black woman lies down beside Dr. Mathison, gazing into a blanket-wrapped bundle. The wriggling bundle is smiled at by the woman as it is gently lifted by the doctor, who looks inside. The doctor, still reflected in the mirror, is seen by the saleswoman, who is looked at by the doctor before the doctor frowns at the baby. A train window is leaned against by a man, who stares out as a station is pulled away from by the train. He is straightened up and leans back in his seat, wearing a dark gray suit, with the top button of his pale green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted. His little hair is kept close shaved, leaving just a dark shadow. A little girl, lying almost upside down, is seen by him as he glances between the seats in front of him. She is grinned at by him, but his grin fades, and he leans towards the window again, rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A blue top is worn by a slim woman in her late 20s, who stretches up to place her coat on the overhead rack, and as this is done, her top parts company with her black trousers. Her exposed white midriff, and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between top and trousers, is gazed at by the man. His wedding ring is furtively slipped off by him and dropped into his jacket pocket. The seat is sat down upon by the young woman, who glances at some leaflets, drops them in the seat pocket, straightens her shoulder-length brown hair, tucks down her top, sits back, and closes her eyes. The magazine is picked up by the man, after he looks down at the seat pocket in front of him, stretches forward, and picks up a magazine, then he looks at a second magazine himself before passing it to her. He swallows and looks at her again, watching another train pass while he looks down before turning to her again. Their hands are shaken, but the magazine is looked down at by her again, then she looks up at him with her smile gone. Her arms are folded and unfolded by her, she tucks her fist under her chin, and shows him her wedding ring. She stands, picks up the leaflets, and moves down the aisle of the train, and his head drops. His wedding ring is pulled from his pocket by him, hesitates for a moment before it is slipped back on, and he settles back in his seat. A little girl in front sitting up now, her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips, is seen by David as he glances between the seat backs, watching him and smiling. He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it, frowning slightly, his eyes closing, while trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the trackside outside.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: In the mirror of a shop changing room, Dr. Mathison sits beside a black woman, smiling at a wriggling bundle. The doctor lifts it gently, looks inside, then frowns at the saleswoman and back at the baby. A man in a dark gray suit leans against a train window, watching the station recede. He straightens, his tie loosely knotted, and smiles tiredly at a little girl staring at him. A woman in her late 20s, wearing a blue top, places her coat on the overhead rack, revealing an ivy tattoo. The man discreetly removes his wedding ring and pockets it. She sits, checks leaflets, adjusts her top, and closes her eyes. The man picks up a magazine, passes it to her, and they shake hands. She shows her wedding ring, stands, and leaves the aisle, as he slips his ring back on. David sees the little girl smiling at him, then turns towards the window as the train passes greenery.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: People are reflected in a shop changing room mirror as Dr. Mathison sits beside a black woman lying down, gazing at a blanket-wrapped bundle. She smiles at the bundle while the doctor gently lifts and looks inside. The doctor, still reflected, looks at the saleswoman, then frowns at the baby. A man in a dark gray suit, with an unbuttoned pale green shirt, leans against a train window as it departs. He notices a little girl staring at him, grins, but then wearily rubs his eye. A slim woman in a blue top stretches to place her coat on the rack, revealing her midriff with an ivy tattoo. The man, in a moment of flirtation, removes his wedding ring. She sits, fixes her hair, tucks her top, and closes her eyes. He picks up two magazines, then gives one to her. They exchange smiles and handshake, but her smile fades as she shows her wedding ring, stands, and moves down the aisle. The man hesitates, then puts his ring back on. David notices the girl again, now sitting up, and leans against the window, eyes closing, as trees pass by.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The scene unfolds with a group of people whose images are captured in the reflective surface of a shop's changing room mirror. They appear tense and apprehensive as they look in. Dr. Mathison is seated beside a black woman who is reclined comfortably. Her focus is directed towards a bundle wrapped delicately in a blanket. The woman beams with a warm smile at the wriggling bundle, filled with life, as the doctor carefully lifts the bundle, peering inside with curiosity. Continuing to be reflected in the mirror, Dr. Mathison shifts his gaze to the saleswoman, returning his attention to the baby with a deepening frown.

Meanwhile, a man is depicted leaning against the window of a train, his eyes gazing outward while the train steadily departs from the station. He then straightens up and reclines back into his seat. He is clad in a well-tailored, dark gray suit, with the top button of his light, pale green shirt left undone, the knot of his tie hanging loosely. His hair is closely shaven, resulting in a mere shadow-like appearance. Peering between the seats just in front of him, he spots a little girl almost turned upside down, intently staring at him. He offers her a grin, but the smile soon vanishes. He leans back towards the window, massaging the inside corner of one eye with a weary motion.

Nearby, a slender woman, appearing to be in her late 20s and dressed in a blue top, stretches upward to place her coat on the overhead rack. As she does this, her blue top momentarily separates from her black trousers, revealing her white midriff. An ivy tattoo, enchanting and verdant, climbs through the gap, capturing the man's gaze. In a discreet action, he slips off his wedding ring and deposits it into his jacket pocket. The young woman then settles into her seat, takes a quick glance at some leaflets before casually dropping them into the seat pocket, smooths her shoulder-length brown hair, adjusts her top, and reclines with her eyes gently closing.

The man directs his attention to the seat pocket in front of him, stretching forward to pick up a magazine, and then grabs a second magazine to peruse briefly before offering it to her. He looks downward, swallows with a hint of nervousness, and then gazes back at her. As another train speeds past their window, he looks down, and once more turns his attention back to her. They exchange a handshake, but as she returns her gaze to the magazine, her smile has disappeared. She crosses and uncrosses her arms, placing a fist pensively under her chin, before revealing her own wedding ring. Rising from her seat, she collects the leaflets and proceeds down the aisle of the train, leaving him behind with his head hung low. After a brief pause, he retrieves his wedding ring from his pocket, hesitating momentarily before returning it to its rightful place on his finger, then settles back into his seat.

Peeking between the backs of the seats, David notices a little girl sitting up straight in front of him, her blonde hair neatly pulled away from her face and secured with bright yellow clips. She watches him, her face alight with a wide smile. David shifts slightly, moving out of her line of sight, leans against the window once more, his expression slightly troubled as his eyelids begin to close. Outside the window, a lush green backdrop of trees and shrubs rushes by, flanking the tracks on either side.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The scene unfolds in a tranquil setting, where a group of people is depicted as their images are vividly captured in the shiny, reflective surface of a shop's changing room mirror. The individuals appear quite tense and filled with apprehension as they peer into the mirror. Dr. Mathison is comfortably seated beside a black woman who is reclining in a relaxed manner. Her undivided focus is directed towards a small bundle, delicately wrapped in a soft blanket. The woman beams, her face glowing with a warm smile at the squirming and wriggling bundle that is so full of life. With attentive care, the doctor lifts the bundle, peering inside with a sense of curiosity. As the mirror continues to reflect this scene, Dr. Mathison shifts his observant gaze towards the saleswoman, only to return his attention to the baby, his expression shifting into a deeper frown.

Meanwhile, elsewhere in the unfolding narrative, a man is portrayed as he leans nonchalantly against the window of a steadily departing train, his eyes fixed on the scene outside. As the train moves away from the station, he straightens his posture, only to recline back into his seat again. This man is dressed in a well-tailored, dark gray suit, the top button of his light, pale green shirt left undone, causing the knot of his tie to hang loosely around his collar. His hair is closely shaven, creating the mere shadow-like appearance of a faint stubble. Peering intently between the seats directly in front of him, he notices a little girl, almost upside down, staring at him with unwavering concentration. He offers her a gentle grin, but the smile soon fades away. He leans back towards the window, massaging the inside corner of one eye with a tired and weary motion.

Nearby, a slender woman, who appears to be in her late 20s, is dressed casually in a blue top. She stretches upwards, reaching to place her coat on the overhead rack. As she performs this action, her blue top momentarily separates from her black trousers, offering a glimpse of her white midriff. An enchanting and verdant ivy tattoo climbs intriguingly through the gap, capturing the man's lingering gaze. In a discreet and careful action, he removes his wedding ring, slipping it quietly into his jacket pocket. The young woman soon settles into her seat, taking a quick glance at some leaflets before casually dropping them into the seat pocket in front of her. She smooths her shoulder-length brown hair, adjusts her top for comfort, and reclines back with her eyes gradually closing.

The man's attention shifts to the seat pocket in front of him. Leaning forward, he picks up a magazine and also grabs a second magazine, which he peruses briefly before offering it to the young woman. He looks downward, swallows with a hint of nervousness, and then gazes back at her with renewed interest. As another train speeds past their window, he looks down again, and once more turns his attention back to her. They exchange a brief handshake, but as she returns her gaze to the magazine, the smile that was once present has disappeared. The woman crosses and then uncrosses her arms, placing a thoughtful fist under her chin, before revealing her own wedding ring. Rising from her seat, she collects the leaflets and proceeds to walk down the aisle of the train, leaving the man behind with his head hanging low in contemplation. After a brief pause, he retrieves his wedding ring from the pocket of his jacket, hesitating for a moment before slipping it back onto its rightful place on his finger, then settles back into his seat with a reflective demeanor.

Peeking between the backs of the seats once more, David notices a little girl sitting up straight in front of him, her blonde hair neatly pulled away from her face, held securely in place with bright yellow clips. She watches him with innocent curiosity, her face illuminated by a wide and joyful smile. David shifts slightly in his seat, moving out of her direct line of sight. He leans back against the window once more, his expression slightly troubled as he closes his eyes slowly. Outside the window, a lush, green backdrop of dense trees and shrubbery rushes by, flanking the speeding train tracks on either side, adding to the sense of movement and passage.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the mirror of a shop changing room, the reflection of people is captured as they peer in with a sense of nervous anticipation. Dr. Mathison is seated beside a black woman who is lying down, her eyes warmly fixed on a bundle wrapped in a blanket. The woman’s face lights up with a smile as she observes the bundle, which is gently wriggling in her arms. Dr. Mathison, with delicate care, lifts the bundle from her embrace, peering inside with a thoughtful expression. Still visible in the mirror, Dr. Mathison shifts his gaze from the baby to the saleswoman, then back again, his features clouding with a slight frown. Meanwhile, a man is seen leaning against the glass of a train window, his eyes distant as the train begins to depart from the station. He straightens his posture and reclines into his seat, dressed in a dark gray suit. The top button of his light green shirt is undone, and his tie hangs loosely around his neck. His closely shaved hair is minimal, casting just a shadow across his scalp. Through the gap between the seats in front of him, he notices a little girl almost upside down, staring directly at him. He responds with a grin, which soon fades. Turning back to the window, he rubs the inner corner of his eye with a sense of weariness. A slender woman in her late twenties, clad in a blue top, reaches upwards to stow her coat on the overhead rack. As she stretches, a gap appears between her top and her black trousers, revealing her white midriff and a segment of an ivy tattoo that snakes through the exposed skin. The man’s gaze is drawn to this, and he discreetly slips off his wedding ring, dropping it into his jacket pocket. The young woman then settles into her seat, casually glancing at some leaflets before sliding them into the seat pocket. She smoothes her shoulder-length brown hair, tugs her top down, and leans back, closing her eyes for a moment of rest. The man, now fully attentive, reaches to the seat pocket in front of him, stretching forward to retrieve a magazine. After a brief look, he picks up a second magazine, glances at it, and hands it over to her. He swallows hard, his eyes moving back to her before turning his attention briefly to the passing landscape, where another train rushes by. He turns back to her again, and they shake hands, but her interest seems to wane as she returns her attention to the magazine, looking back up at him without the previous warmth in her smile. She shifts in her seat, her arms folding and unfolding, and tucks her fist under her chin, revealing her own wedding ring. Rising from her seat, she gathers the leaflets and walks down the aisle of the train, leaving him with his head bowed in contemplation. Hesitantly, he retrieves his wedding ring from his pocket, pausing briefly before slipping it back onto his finger and sinking back into his seat. As he glances once more between the seat backs, David notices the little girl in front who is now sitting upright. Her blond hair is neatly pulled away from her face with bright yellow clips, her eyes watching him with a friendly smile. He shifts out of her view, turning towards the window, and leans against it with a slight frown, his eyelids drooping, while outside, the rush of greenery flies past, creating a verdant backdrop to the tracks.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: In a shop changing room reflected in a mirror, Dr. Mathison sits beside a black woman who's lying down, smiling at a blanket-wrapped bundle. The doctor lifts the bundle gently, peers inside, and then looks up at the saleswoman before frowning back at the baby. Meanwhile, a man in a dark gray suit leans against a train window as it departs a station. He adjusts his position, revealing a shadow of shaved hair, then exchanges a grin with a little girl before turning back to the window, rubbing his eye wearily. Nearby, a slim woman in her late 20s stretches to place her coat on the overhead rack, inadvertently exposing a tattooed midriff that catches the man's gaze. He discreetly slips his wedding ring into his pocket. The woman sits, glimpses at some leaflets, tidies her hair and top, and closes her eyes. The man retrieves a magazine, passes it to her after a glance, exchanges looks with her amidst watching another train pass, and they shake hands. Noticing her wedding ring, she stands, collects the leaflets, and moves down the aisle, leaving him to replace his ring and settle back. The man catches sight of the little girl, now sitting up with her blonde hair clipped back, smiling at him. He retreats to the window, leans against it, closing his eyes as the passing scenery blurs outside.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room, a common feature in clothing stores to help customers assess fit and style, peering in nervously as Dr. Mathison, a renowned pediatrician known for her gentle approach with newborns, sits beside a black woman who's lying down, gazing into a blanket-wrapped bundle. The woman smiles at the wriggling bundle, a newborn baby wrapped in a traditional hospital receiving blanket, as the doctor gently lifts it and looks inside. Still reflected in the mirror, the doctor looks up at the saleswoman, who is known in the store for her attentiveness to customers, and then back at the baby, frowning slightly in concentration. A man is leaning against a train window, the outside of which showcases the bustling platform of a central city station, staring out as the train pulls away from a station. He straightens up, leans back in his seat, wearing a dark gray suit, the standard attire for business professionals, with the top button of his pale green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted. The little hair he has is close shaved, leaving just a dark shadow, a style often favored for its low maintenance. Glancing between the seats in front of him, he sees a little girl lying almost upside down, a common position for curious children, staring back at him. He grins at her, but the grin fades as he remembers the long day, and he leans towards the window again, rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A slim woman in her late 20s, wearing a blue top that matches the corporate dress code of many tech companies, stretches up to place her coat on the overhead rack, and as she does, the top parts company with her black trousers. The man gazes at her exposed white midriff and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between top and trousers, a design often chosen for its symbolism of growth and resilience. He furtively slips off his wedding ring and drops it into his jacket pocket. The young woman sits down, glances at some leaflets about a local tourist attraction, drops them in the seat pocket, straightens her shoulder-length brown hair, tucks down her top, sits back, and closes her eyes, taking a moment of respite. The man looks down at the seat pocket in front of him, stretches forward, and picks up a magazine, then picks up a second magazine filled with travel articles, looks at it himself before passing it to her. The man looks down, swallows with a mix of anticipation and doubt, and looks at her again, watching another train, part of a high-speed rail line, pass and looking down before turning to her again. They shake hands in a gesture that seems formal yet tentative, but she looks down at the magazine again, then up at him with her smile gone, the reality of their situations settling in. She folds and unfolds her arms, tucks her fist under her chin, a position often signaling contemplation, and shows him her wedding ring. She stands, picks up the leaflets, and moves down the aisle of the train, and his head drops in a moment of regret. He pulls his wedding ring from his pocket, hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on, signifying a return to commitment, and settles back in his seat. Glancing between the seat backs, David sees a little girl in front sitting up now, her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips often used for school routines, watching him and smiling. He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly, his eyes closing, while outside, trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side on this scenic journey.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. He straightens up leans back in his seat wearing a dark gray suit with the top button of his pale green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted. The little hair he has is close shaved leaving just a dark shadow. Glancing between the seats in front of him he sees a little girl lying almost upside down staring back at him. He grins at her but the grin fades and he leans towards the window again rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A slim woman in her late 20s wearing a blue top stretches up to place her coat on the overhead rack and as she does the top parts company with her black trousers and the man gazes at her exposed white midriff and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between top and trousers. He flirtively slips off his wedding ring and drops it into his jacket pocket. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. The young woman sits down glances at some leaflets drops them in the seat pocket straightens her shoulderlength. brown hair tucks down her top sits back and closes her eyes. The man looks down at the seat pocket in front of him stretches forward and picks up a magazine then picks up a second magazine looks at it himself before passing it to her. The man looks down swallows and looks at her again watching another train pass and looking down before turning to her again. They shake hands but she looks down at the magazine again then up at him with her smile gone. She folds and unfolds her arms tucks her fist under her chin and shows him her wedding ring. She stands picks up the leaflets and moves down the aisle of the train and his head drops. He pulls his wedding ring from his pocket hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on and settles back in his seat. Glancing between the seat backs David sees a little girl in front sitting up now her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips watching him and smiling. He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly his eyes closing while outside trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room peering in nervously as Dr Mathison sits beside a black woman who is lying down gazing into a blanket wrapped bundle. The women smiles at the wriggling bundle as the doctor gently lifts it and looks inside. Still reflected in the mirror the doctor looks up at the saleswoman and then back at the baby frowning. A man is leaning against a train window staring out as the train pulls away from a station. He straightens up leans back in his seat wearing a dark gray suit with the top button of his pale green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted. She folds and unfolds her arms tucks her fist under her chin and shows him her wedding ring. She stands picks up the leaflets and moves down the aisle of the train and his head drops. He pulls his wedding ring from his pocket hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on and settles back in his seat. Glancing between the seat backs David sees a little girl in front sitting up now her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips watching him and smiling. He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly his eyes closing while outside trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room peering in nervously as Dr Mathison sits beside a black woman who is lying down gazing into a blanket wrapped bundle. The women smiles at the wriggling bundle as the doctor gently lifts it and looks inside. Glancing between the seat backs David sees a little girl in front sitting up now her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips watching him and smiling. He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly his eyes closing while outside trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room, peering in nervously as the librarian sits beside a penguin who's lying down, gazing into a blanket wrapped bundle. The penguin smiles at the wriggling bundle as the librarian gently lifts it and looks inside. Still reflected in the mirror, the librarian looks up at the firefighter and then back at the baby, frowning. A squirrel is leaning against a train window, staring out as the train pulls away from a station. It straightens up, leans back in its seat, wearing a dark gray suit, with the top button of its pale green shirt undone and its tie loosely knotted. The little fur it has is close shaved, leaving just a dark shadow. Glancing between the seats in front of it, the squirrel sees a little girl lying almost upside down, staring back at it. It grins at her, but the grin fades, and it leans towards the window again, rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A lioness in her late 20s, wearing a blue top, stretches up to place her coat on the overhead rack, and as she does, the top parts company with her black trousers, and the squirrel gazes at her exposed white midriff and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between top and trousers. It flirtively slips off its wedding ring and drops it into its jacket pocket. The young lioness sits down, glances at some leaflets, drops them in the seat pocket, straightens her shoulder-length brown hair, tucks down her top, sits back, and closes her eyes. The squirrel looks down at the seat pocket in front of it, stretches forward, and picks up a magazine, then picks up a second magazine, looks at it itself before passing it to her. The squirrel looks down, swallows, and looks at her again, watching another train pass and looking down before turning to her again. They shake hands, but she looks down at the magazine again, then up at it with her smile gone. She folds and unfolds her arms, tucks her fist under her chin, and shows it her wedding ring. She stands, picks up the leaflets, and moves down the aisle of the train, and its head drops. It pulls its wedding ring from its pocket, hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on, and settles back in its seat. Glancing between the seat backs, the chef sees a little girl in front sitting up now, her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips, watching it and smiling. It moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly, its eyes closing, while outside, trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: People are reflected in the window of a bakery display, peering in nervously as Dr. Mathison sits beside a black woman who's lying down, gazing into a silk scarf wrapped bundle. The woman smiles at the wriggling bundle as the doctor gently lifts it and looks inside. Still reflected in the window, the doctor looks up at the cashier and then back at the puppy, frowning. A man is leaning against a tram window, staring out as the tram pulls away from a terminal. He straightens up, leans back in his seat, wearing a dark gray blazer, with the top button of his pale green polo undone and his scarf loosely tied. The little hair he has is close shaved, leaving just a dark shadow. Glancing between the armrests in front of him, he sees a little boy lying almost upside down, staring back at him. He grins at him, but the grin fades, and he leans towards the window again, rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A slim woman in her late 20s, wearing a red dress, stretches up to place her bag on the overhead shelf, and as she does, the top parts company with her black pants, and the man gazes at her exposed white midriff and the section of vine tattoo climbing through the gap between dress and pants. He flirtively slips off his bracelet and drops it into his coat pocket. The young woman sits down, glances at some brochures, drops them in the seat pocket, straightens her shoulder-length red hair, tucks down her dress, sits back, and closes her eyes. The man looks down at the seat pocket in front of him, stretches forward, and picks up a brochure, then picks up a second brochure, looks at it himself before passing it to her. The man looks down, swallows, and looks at her again, watching another tram pass and looking down before turning to her again. They shake hands, but she looks down at the brochure again, then up at him with her smile gone. She folds and unfolds her arms, tucks her fist under her chin, and shows him her bracelet. She stands, picks up the brochures, and moves down the aisle of the tram, and his head drops. He pulls his bracelet from his pocket, hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on, and settles back in his seat. Glancing between the armrests, David sees a little boy in front sitting up now, his blonde hair pulled off his face and held by blue clips, watching him and smiling. He moves out of his sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly, his eyes closing, while outside, buildings and cars form a concrete backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room, frowning nervously as Dr. Mathison stands beside a black woman who's sitting up, smiling into a blanket wrapped bundle. The woman nods at the wriggling bundle as the doctor slowly lowers it and glances inside. Still reflected in the mirror, the doctor squints at the saleswoman and then back at the baby, grinning. A man is slouching against a train window, yawning as the train glides away from a station. He slumps down, curls up in his seat, wearing a dark gray suit, with the top button of his pale green shirt fastened and his tie neatly knotted. The little hair he has is shaved clean, leaving just a light shadow. Peering between the seats in front of him, he notices a little girl sitting almost upright, waving back at him. He frowns at her, but the frown brightens, and he collapses against the window again, patting the side of one eye wearily. A slim woman in her late 20s, wearing a blue top, crouches down to retrieve her coat from the overhead rack, and as she does, the top joins company with her black trousers, and the man averts his eyes from her exposed white midriff and the section of ivy tattoo hiding through the gap between top and trousers. He discreetly puts on his wedding ring and tucks it back into his jacket pocket. The young woman stands up, collects some leaflets, places them in the seat pocket, shakes her shoulder-length brown hair, pulls down her top, leans forward, and opens her eyes. The man looks up at the seat pocket in front of him, leans back, and flips through a magazine, then flips through a second magazine, stares at it himself before dropping it beside her. The man looks up, coughs, and looks at her once more, observing another train approach and looking up before glancing at her again. They nod, but she looks back at the magazine again, then away from him with her smile fading. She crosses and uncrosses her legs, rests her fist under her chin, and reveals to him her wedding ring. She sits, collects the leaflets, and slides down the aisle of the train, and his head rises. He retrieves his wedding ring from his pocket, contemplates for a moment before tucking it back away, and slouches down in his seat. Peering between the seat backs, David notices a little girl in front standing now, her blonde hair pulled off her face and held by yellow clips, ignoring him and smiling. He moves into her view towards the window and leans against it smiling slightly, his eyes opening, while outside, clouds and sky form a serene backdrop along the track side.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Mailboxes are reflected in the pond of a garden gazebo, peering in nervously as Professor Clearwater sits beside a tall sunflower who's lying down, gazing into a chocolate-wrapped bundle. The sunflower smiles at the wriggling bundle as the professor gently lifts it and looks inside. Still reflected in the pond, the professor looks up at the librarian and then back at the cupcake, frowning. A refrigerator is leaning against a rainbow, staring out as the rainbow pulls away from a canyon. It straightens up, leans back in its seat, wearing a dark purple cape, with the top button of its pale orange shirt undone and its scarf loosely knotted. The little feathers it has are close shaved, leaving just a dark shadow. Glancing between the clouds in front of it, it sees a small potato lying almost upside down, staring back at it. It grins at the potato, but the grin fades, and it leans towards the rainbow again, rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily. A slender giraffe in its late 20s, wearing a red scarf, stretches up to place its umbrella on the treetop rack, and as it does, the scarf parts company with its checkered trousers, and the refrigerator gazes at its exposed white branch and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between scarf and trousers. It flirtively slips off its engagement ring and drops it into its backpack pocket. The young giraffe sits down, glances at some maps, drops them in the basket pocket, straightens its shoulder-length green vines, tucks down its scarf, sits back, and closes its eyes. The refrigerator looks down at the basket pocket in front of it, stretches forward, and picks up a novel, then picks up a second novel, looks at it itself before passing it to the giraffe. The refrigerator looks down, swallows, and looks at the giraffe again, watching another rainbow pass and looking down before turning to the giraffe again. They shake hooves, but the giraffe looks down at the novel again, then up at the refrigerator with its smile gone. The giraffe folds and unfolds its branches, tucks its hoof under its chin, and shows the refrigerator its engagement ring. The giraffe stands, picks up the maps, and moves down the aisle of the rainbow, and its head drops. It pulls its engagement ring from its pocket, hesitates for a moment before slipping it back on, and settles back in its seat. Glancing between the cloud backs, Oliver sees a small potato in front sitting up now, its blue vines pulled off its face and held by green ribbons, watching it and smiling. It moves out of the potato's sight towards the rainbow and leans against it frowning slightly, its eyes closing, while outside, raindrops and butterflies form a green backdrop along the riverside.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Dogs are reflected in the mirror of a shop nursery room, sneaking in curiously as Mrs. Johnson stands beside a blue cat who's sitting up, glancing into a blanket wrapped parcel. The cat grins at the squirming parcel as the nurse cautiously pulls it and peers inside. Still reflected in the mirror, the nurse glances over at the musician and then back at the parcel, sighing. A horse is leaning against a train window, gazing out as the train hurries away from a depot. It sits up, shifts on its hooves, wearing a dark gray suit, with the top button of its pale green shirt undone and its tie loosely unknotted. The little mane it has is closely trimmed, leaving just a dark trace. Peering between the seats in front of it, it notices a little duck standing almost in its place, glaring back at it. It smiles at the duck, but the smile disappears, and it tilts towards the window again, scratching the inside corner of one hoof thoughtfully. A hefty knight in her late 40s, wearing a pink robe, bends down to place her helmet on the overhead rack, and as she does, the robe parts company with her silver trousers, and the horse glimpses at her uncovered blue midriff and the section of vine tattoo entwining through the gap between robe and trousers. It secretly takes off its hat and slips it into its satchel pocket. The knight perches down, peers at some scrolls, drops them in the seat pocket, adjusts her shoulder-length golden mane, fastens down her robe, settles back, and closes her eyes. The horse looks up at the seat pocket in front of it, crouches forward, and grabs a scroll, then grabs a second scroll, reads it himself before handing it to her. The horse looks up, gulps, and glances at her again, observing another train zoom by and looking up before focusing on her again. They bow heads, but she looks up at the scroll again, then back at it with her laugh lost. She twists and untwists her fingers, rests her elbow on her knee, and reveals to it her crown. She stands, takes the scrolls, and strides down the aisle of the train, and its head slumps. It pulls its hat from its pocket, pauses for a moment before placing it back on, and reclines back in its spot. Peering between the seat gaps, Charles sees a little duckling ahead sitting still now, its amber feathers pulled off its face and held by green clips, observing him and chuckling. He retreats out of its sight towards the window and leans against it grimacing slightly, his eyes shutting, while outside, mountains and fields form a blue panorama along the track side.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: People are projected in the glass of a store fitting room, glancing in curiously as Dr. Mathison lounges beside a black woman who's reclining, inspecting a pillow-wrapped parcel. The woman grins at the twitching parcel as the doctor casually hoists it and peers within. Still projected in the glass, the doctor glances up at the cashier and then back at the puppy, grimacing. A man is slouched against a ferry window, gazing out as the ferry glides past a dock. He sits up, reclines back in his chair, wearing a charcoal gray jacket, with the top button of his light green sweater undone and his scarf loosely draped. The little hair he has is closely trimmed, leaving just a faint shadow. Peering over the chairs in front of him, he notices a little girl lying almost topsy-turvy, peeking back at him. He smirks at her, but the smirk vanishes, and he turns towards the window again, scratching the side of one eye tiredly. A thin woman in her late 20s, wearing a crimson shirt, reaches up to hang her scarf on the overhead rail, and as she does, the shirt separates from her navy slacks, and the man peers at her revealed ivory waistline and the vine tattoo winding through the gap between shirt and slacks. He discreetly removes his watch and slides it into his coat pocket. The young woman settles down, scans some brochures, discards them in the seat holder, adjusts her shoulder-length chestnut hair, smooths down her shirt, leans back, and shuts her eyes. The man glances down at the seat holder in front of him, leans forward, and grabs a travel guide, then grabs a second travel guide, reviews it himself before handing it to her. The man gazes downward, gulps, and glances at her again, noticing another ferry glide by and looking down before turning to her again. They exchange a handshake, but she returns her attention to the travel guide, then up at him with her smile erased. She wraps and unwraps her arms, places her palm under her chin, and shows him her wristwatch. She stands, gathers the brochures, and advances down the corridor of the ferry, and his chin drops. He retrieves his watch from his pocket, pauses for a moment before sliding it back on, and reclines back in his chair. Peering over the chair backs, David spots a little girl in front sitting upright now, her golden hair pulled back and secured by lemon clips, observing him and smirking. He shifts out of her view towards the window and leans against it with a slight grimace, his eyes closing, while outside, clouds and sky provide a blue backdrop along the route.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Creatures are mirrored in the lake of a forest clearing, glancing in curiously as Captain Thorne crouches beside a green goblin who's floating up, staring into a haystack-covered heap. The goblin chuckles at the tossing heap as the captain cautiously nudges it and peers inside. Still mirrored in the lake, the captain glances up at the groundskeeper and then back at the kitten, scowling. A zebra is lounging against a boat sail, gazing out as the boat drifts away from a harbor. It stands tall, reclines back in its space, wearing a navy blue harness, with the bottom buckle of its neon yellow vest unfastened and its leash loosely coiled. The few stripes it has are closely trimmed, leaving just a faint outline. Peering between the sails ahead, it spots a tiny alien hovering nearly sideways, peering back at it. It chortles at the alien, but the chortle diminishes, and it tilts towards the sail again, scratching the outer edge of one hoof absently. A broad cat in its early 40s, donning a red scarf, bends down to place its hat on the sea shelf, and as it does, the scarf parts ways with its tan overalls, and the zebra gawks at its revealed purple tail and the trail of stars tattoo spiraling through the divide between scarf and overalls. It stealthily slides off its saddle clasp and drops it into its satchel. The youthful cat curls down, eyeballs some brochures, tosses them in the rail compartment, smooths its shoulder-length ginger fur, tucks up its scarf, cuddles down, and shuts its eyes. The zebra gazes over at the rail compartment beside it, extends upward, and retrieves a newspaper, then retrieves a second newspaper, thumbs through it personally before handing it to the cat. The zebra gazes down, gulps, and gazes at the cat again, observing another boat sail by and gazing down before pivoting back to the cat once more. They bump paws, but the cat glances down at the newspaper again, then up at the zebra with its grin vanished. It folds and unfolds its whiskers, rests its paw under its ear, and displays its saddle clasp. It rises, scoops up the brochures, and saunters down the dock of the boat, and the zebra's mane drops. It pulls its saddle clasp from its satchel, pauses momentarily before sliding it back on, and slumps back in its space. Peering between the sail masts, Alex spots a tiny alien in front now seated upright, its crimson feathers swept off its beak and fastened by turquoise clips, observing the zebra and grinning. It sidles out of view towards the sail and rests against it with a slight grimace, its eyes drifting shut, while beyond, hills and clouds create an azure panorama along the seaside.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In a shop changing room, Dr. Mathison sits beside a black woman with a baby. He gently examines the infant while others watch anxiously. Meanwhile, on a train, a man in a dark gray suit notices a girl staring at him upside down. Distracted, he observes a woman in her late 20s stretching to place her coat, revealing a tattoo on her midriff. He removes his wedding ring, then tries to engage her by offering a magazine. She declines his attention, reveals her own wedding ring, and moves down the aisle, prompting the man to reluctantly put his ring back on. A little girl in front smiles at him, but he turns to the window, eyes closing as he leans against it, with trees and shrubs passing by outside.

her face and held by yellow clips watching him and smiling He moves out of her sight towards the window and leans against it frowning slightly his eyes closing while outside trees and shrubs form a green backdrop along the track side People are reflected in the mirror of a shop changing room peering in nervously as Dr Mathison sits beside a black woman who is lying down gazing into a blanket wrapped bundle The women smiles at the wriggling bundle as the doctor gently lifts it and looks inside Still reflected in the mirror the doctor looks up at the saleswoman and then back at the baby frowning A man is leaning against a train window staring out as the train pulls away from a station He straightens up leans back in his seat wearing a dark gray suit with the top button of his pale green shirt undone and his tie loosely knotted The little hair he has is close shaved leaving just a dark shadow Glancing between the seats in front of him he sees a little girl lying almost upside down staring back at him He grins at her but the grin fades and he leans towards the window again rubbing the inside corner of one eye wearily A slim woman in her late 20s wearing a blue top stretches up to place her coat on the overhead rack and as she does the top parts company with her black trousers and the man gazes at her exposed white midriff and the section of ivy tattoo climbing through the gap between top and trousers He flirtively slips off his wedding ring and drops it into his jacket pocket
